message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been highly rated by many satisfied customers. Considering its value and quality, I believe it's worth more than $120. Would you be interested in purchasing it today? My initial offer is $140.
Thanks for the offer, Alice. I appreciate the quality of your product, but I'm only able to pay $120 at this time. Would you be willing to consider that price?

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your budget constraints. I would like to make a counteroffer at $130 for the product. This still allows me to cover my costs and makes it slightly more appealing than your offer. Let me know if this works for you.
Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price. $130 is still a bit high for me.  I'm willing to go up to $125.  Let me know if that works for you.

Thank you for considering my offer, Bob. I appreciate your willingness to increase your bid. In light of that, I am willing to accept $128 for the product. This price allows me to maintain a reasonable profit margin while still being competitive in the market.

Alice, I really appreciate your flexibility, but $128 is still a bit more than I can comfortably spend. Would you be willing to meet me in the middle at $124? It's a fair price for both of us, and it would allow us to close this deal.

I understand your position, Bob. To accommodate you better, I propose a final offer of $126 for the product. This price reflects a compromise that allows us to reach an agreement while ensuring a reasonable profit margin for me.
